name: Tottoko Hamutarou: Tomodachi Daisakusen Dechu
overview: Tottoko Hamutaro: Tomodachi Daisakusen Dechu is a Game Boy Color video game released by Nintendo. The game was the first in Nintendo's Hamtaro series, and was released exclusively in Japan (whereas future entries in the series would make their way to North America and Europe). The game is based on the books that were released in Japan under the Hamtaro name. In the game you have conversations with Hamtaro. Unlike its successors, this game is play using a real-time internal clock that keeps track of the current time. Also the player does not controls Hamtaro or follow Hamtaro on his adventure, which he takes from time to time.
